intro: Peucedanum besserianum, commonly known as the Balkan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, parsley-like scent. Peucedanum besserianum is often found in grassy areas and along forest edges, thriving in temperate climates.
